metadata.title: CVE-2016-2779 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
runuser in util-linux allows local users to escape to the parent sessionvia a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal'sinput buffer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2779` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdextrautils - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
eject - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
fdisk - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
libblkid1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
libfdisk1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
libmount1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
libsmartcols1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
libuuid1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
mount - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
rfkill - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
util-linux - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
util-linux-locales - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
uuid-runtime - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
bsdutils - 1:2.36.1-8ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: util-linux package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2').
